document.p: To open the Gateway page, click the Gateway card in the Advanced View .
The Gateway page displays the following information:
document.li1:
MAC Address
The unique hexadecimal code that identifies a device on a network. Each network-enabled device has at least one unique MAC address.

Uptime
The time elapsed since power on of the .

System Time
The time used by the . This time is used for the Time of Day (ToD) and event logs.

Network Timezone
Check this check box to automatically select the time zone based on the active NTP server.

Current Timezone
The time zone that is currently used or selected.

NTP servers
A Network Time Protocol (NTP) server makes sure that the time settings of your are perfectly synchronized with the official time. Click:

Restart Device
Click Restart to restart the .
Keep in mind that during the restart all services offered by the (Internet access, Phone, etc.) will be interrupted.

Factory Defaults
Click Reset to return to the factory default settings.
If you want to keep your DECT shared contacts, select the Retain Contacts check box before clicking Reset.A reset to factory default settings deletes all configuration changes you made. Therefore, after the reset a reconfiguration of your will be needed. Also your wireless clients will have to be re-associated.
